entry.title: media: Add decrypt support to RemoteCdmContext
entry.content:
This is needed for out of process video decoding for protected content

where decryption needs to be invoked from the same process that is doing

decoding. This is part of the V4L2 ARM design where the V4L2Decoder

provide the secure buffers to the pipeline's decryptor.



BUG=b:328801440

TEST=OOPVD secure playback doesn't crash on geralt

entry.title: Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts
entry.content:
While moving ByteSwap() callers, I found the DTS code doing byte swaps

by casting byte spans to uint16_t spans, which causes UB if they are

not aligned. The function explicitly handles non-16-bit aligned inputs

earlier, so clearly it's expected and we should not CHECK on the

alignment. So instead, change the code to work with bytes and do the

swaps in a for loop.



While here, make use of the new split_at() to split the output span

up into disjoint subspans that are each written to.



R=dalecurtis@chromium.org



Bug: 40284755

entry.title: [DefaultPrompt] Implement new reprompt logic
entry.content:
When the DefaultBrowserPromptRefresh feature is enabled, reprompt the

user based on the last declined time/declined count. The duration

between declining the prompt and another one being shown will follow

an exponential backoff determined by the feature params.



This CL also moves the migration function for the last declined time

pref to MigrateObsoleteLocalStatePrefs in browser_prefs.cc. Previously

it was being called in ShouldShowDefaultBrowserPrompt because

local_state() could be a nullptr if it was called from

MigrateObsoleteLocalStatePrefs. Since I found that this would only

happen in tests, after adding a check to short circuit if local state is

null, we can safely move the function to it's intended call site.





Fixed: 326078968

entry.title: Fix how inclusive language exemptions are generated.
entry.content:
Before this CL

`infra/update_inclusive_language_presubmit_exempt_dirs.sh` would be run

before `git add -f third_party/rust` which meant that it missed

exemptions needed by the new crate versions. This CL fixes this by

reordering when such `git add ...` happens.



This CL also makes the following additional improvements that were

identified as desirable during this week's crate updating rotation:



* `tools/rust/update_rust.py` is run at the start of the script.

This takes care of one prerequisite for running the script in a

`git-new-workdir` environment. And in general, ensuring that

`third_party/rust-toolchain` version matches the current branch

seems desirable.



* The title of the CL description has been refactored to 1) mention

the crate name early (for easier readability in environments that only

show the first X characters of a title) and 2) to mention both the old

and the new versions of the main crate being updated (still not

mentioning transitively updated crates in the title, but they are

already mentioned in the main body of the CL description)



* The `cargo vet` criteria are discovered 1) *after* `gnrt vendor` (an

update shouldn't change the criteria required for the main crate but

criteria of transitive dependencies may be affected by an update) and

2) the CL description covers per-crate criteria (to provide complete

information, which may be important in cases where transitive

dependencies have different criteria from the main crate being

updated).



* There are also some opportunistic refactorings of the script

(e.g. adding type annotations).



Bug: 40221377

Change-Id: I59e77b753617ce72882a789aab9be3ff2811292a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367004

entry.title: Fix primary display race condition crash on Windows
entry.content:
In rare cases, it's possible for the OS to provide us a list of displays

that doesn't contain the primary display. This situation causes

undefined behavior (dereference past vector end) and a crash to occur in

|display::win::(anon)::DisplayInfosToScreenWinDisplays| on builds

without DCHECK enabled.

entry.title: Re-map quic:// to https:// proxy specs when parsing ONC proxy settings
entry.content:
If an administrator specifies a quic:// protocol proxy, it is actually

treated as https:// today.



The quic:// proxy protocol prefix is being removed.



Until no customer is using quic:// anymore, re-map quic:// to https://

when ingesting ONC proxy settings so that the quic proxy protocol scheme

can be already removed from downstream code.

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Split up resolution change event
entry.content:
On a resolution change the queues need to be torn down.

When they are torn down there are resources that need to

be returned. Posting a delayed task allows the events

surrounding the queue teardown to take place before

instantiating new queues.



A similar approach was tried with crrev.com/c/5353737.

This CL improves on that by also allowing any posted

messages to be handled after the queue is reset.

> [test] Suppress generation of stack traces in death tests

>

> In https://crrev.com/1246434, we suppressed symbolized stack traces in

> death test child procs. While this worked for CHECK and DCHECK messages,

entry.title: Return nullopt on error from ProcessMetrics CPU measurements
entry.content:
This lets callers distinguish errors from processes that have used no

CPU, and makes all platforms behave the same on error (previously

some returned 0, some returned negative numbers, and Fuchsia crashed

on error).



* Wraps the return type of ProcessMetrics::GetCumulativeCPUUsage()

and ProcessMetrics::GetPlatformIndependentCPUUsage() in

std::optional.

* Adds a GetProcStatsFieldAsOptionalInt64() to internal_linux.cc to

use in the Linux implementation.

* Adds safety to the Linux implementation by checking for negative

values in /proc/stats and using ClampAdd to prevent overflows.

* Changes the Fuchsia implementation to return nullopt on error

instead of CHECK'ing, for consistency.

* Updates all callers to handle nullopt by ignoring the CPU result when

possible, or treating it as 0 when a value is required.



R=danakj



Bug: 40285287

Change-Id: I18717eaf88b6ce5241030ead31ce6ea95d348cd0

entry.title: webview: Check exceptions for default video poster
entry.content:
WebView relies on the application context resources which may fail if

the application is some how changing this.



To try help mitigate app issues, we can add an empty bitmap as a

fallback rather than doing a hard failure. This doesn't solve the root

cause.



It doesn't seem like there are currently any automated tests around this

code - only code that calls it in turn but normally mocks it out. All I

could test was manually making sure the empty bitmap was fine.

> This CL updates link capturing to only close the captured tab if

> the navigation was not from a user gesture within the tab.

> This fixes a bug where pages that set location.href = url in

> JavaScript in response to a user click were being closed erroneously.

>

> This CL also backfills missing test coverage around the tab closing

> code path.

entry.title: Protected Audience: add some metrics for aborts
entry.content:
Add Ads.InterestGroup.{AuctionType}.StateAtAbortTime to track the

status of an auction that's aborted via AuctionRunner::Abort(). In the process add Ads.InterestGroup.{AuctionType}.StateAtFailTime so that we can do the same for failures.



Add Ads.InterestGroup.{AuctionType}.SignaledAbortTime to understand if there is a delay between an Abort() and the InterestGroupAuction destruction.



Also add some checks in various AuctionRunner functions to make

sure further steps of the auction don't proceed in case the

auction had already failed.

entry.title: A followup of crrev.com/c/5296786.
entry.content:
In this CL, the API of ScopedLayerTreeSynchronizer is updated. Instead

of synchronizing the entire tree to root_layer rounded corners, users

can now specify rounded corner bounds and a subtree of root_layer that

should be synchronized.



This generalization is required to use the class for overview case

in followup changes.



This CL also moves the synchronization of the layer tree from

WindowPreviewView to WindowCycleItemView. This change is made because

WindowPreviewView is used in various contexts, and the synchronization

is only desired for alt-tab and overview.



Finally, this CL makes a few readability improvements.

order. It has no functional impact but makes the LSP happy.

the entire file. This has no functional difference as they are all

the optional ones.

readable one (avoids potential confusion between 1 and l, suggested by

LSP).

entry.content:
Right now, an incorrect password prompt is counted as a deep scan

failure. This may be technically accurate, as the file was not

successfully scanned, but it does not help to understand trends in deep

scanning performance. This CL splits the two buckets for a more

understandable metric.



This CL also adds a new histogram to log whether the incorrect password

result came from the client or the server.

entry.title: Make `run_cargo_vet.py` more idempotent.
entry.content:
This CL ensures that:



* Changes to `imports.lock` are ignored via `.gitignore` (and that when

this file doesn't exist, then `cargo vet` still works because now we

will create an empty file in this case).

* Changes to `config.toml` are reverted (when the only difference is in

the comments) or warned about (for non-trivial changes)



This CL also opportunistically updates `docs/rust.md` instructions about

how to install `cargo-vet`:



* It adds a TODO to avoid the need to manually install `cargo-vet`

* It specifies an explicit version (0.9.1 seems to work well)

* It uses `--locked` to ensure `cargo-vet`'s dependencies cannot

be tampered with (i.e. that we only need to trust the publishers

of `cargo-vet` + `crates.io` + `rust-toolchain`)



Bug: 41494083

Change-Id: I7056537ecfb34197f5102df93dddbe152838a073

entry.title: [history] Do not use json lookup API for app-specific history
entry.content:
History json API handled by WebHistoryService for lookup/delete

is in maintenance mode, does not accept new patches any more.

Therefore it cannot be updated to process app_id to handle

app-specific history-related requests i.e. it always returns

full history results.



This CL keeps app-specific history query from invoking json api.

It lets us avoid having the full history results from the service

mixed with the local app-specific query results.

entry.title: [dPWA][SystemMediaControls][Win] Handling for when audio stops.
entry.content:
Properly hide the Windows system media controls UI when a media session from a dPWA stops playing for any reason (navigation away from the page, end of track, etc). (Previously, when audio ended the Windows media controls UI would still be visible, but you couldn't interact with it).



Add a testing helper to the SystemMediaControls interface. Used on Windows only (for now) with empty implementation everywhere else.



Bug: 326411160

Change-Id: Id19ecd13971719cd6d91e593d0e567c624c5220b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318786

Reviewed-by: Amanda Baker

Reviewed-by: Tommy Steimel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271728}

entry.title: Do a browsing context swap when a contaminated prefetch is used.
entry.content:
This further reduces the visibility that these pages can have into each

others' activity. Fortunately, we do BCG swaps in several cases so this

isn't too complicated.



This is guarded by a FeatureParam so that we can separately control this

behavior in the event it is suspected of causing surprising effects. It

defaults to off but will default to on shortly if all goes well.



Bug: 1439246

Change-Id: I80039754a10418708d575035368ad70f7f6deeba

entry.title: [Android] Unbatch TabsTest to isolate failures
entry.content:
The test already had hidden flakes and local failures, and extracting

out ToolbarSwipeTest added even more hidden flakes. The disabled tests

in this suite are likely disabled due to side effects too.



This CL unbatches the test because it's not workable in its current

batched state. The test cases need to be fixed to work locally and

vetted on CI separately before trying to batch them again.

entry.title: [docs] Update extension-related instructions for VS Code editor.
entry.content:
This CL mainly includes the following changes:



1. Update the "Useful Extensions" for VS Code. ChromiumIDE-specific ones

are added, and outdated extensions are removed.

2. Polish the "Setup for Chromium" section. Now it suggests copying all

VS Code configurations from the Chromium checkout.

3. Add a list of recommended VS Code extensions into

`tools/vscode/extensions.json`, such that users can just install them

all from the VS Code UI.

4. Update `tools/vscode/settings.json` to include a recommended C/C++

configuration from the doc.



Change-Id: Iea24a9203989ecab5248836f72e0cc369fa46c9e

entry.title: Add feature to control using NV12_SINGLE_GMB
entry.content:
For software GMB video path add a feature that controls if

NV12_SINGLE_GMB or NV12_DUAL_GMB is used. This maintains the existing

logic, NV12_SINGLE_GMB is always used for Mac+Windows and other

platforms use NV12_DUAL_GMB. The feature can be made enabled by default

as a follow up and act as a kill switch for Linux/Chrome OS.



Bug: 40283225

Change-Id: I63b4fd04e4b7b2fe519ac4c5ce8cc1177c18eca3

entry.title: Implement a UKM that tracks cross-origin LCP images.
entry.content:
A cross-origin LCP image request incurs additional latency due to

new connection and TLS handshake costs, vs. a same-origin LCP image.

We could investigate and improve the LCP metric of Core Web Vitals,

by collecting stats on what portion of the web embeds cross-origin

images as their LCP element.



This CL implements a UKM that tracks cross-origin LCP image occurrences.

Also introduces a cross-origin flag into LargestContentfulPaintType

bitfield.



UKM collection review document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/13ZCL7iLgnAl2mnyfWlDM72rRiFhzOgOAwe3Ot2JXEew/edit?usp=sharing



Change-Id: I0abe9fca2be6316475d2876fc411a0059968bdc7

entry.title: Always use the limited entropy provider for studies constrained to the limited layer.
entry.content:
The logic in VariationsLayers::SelectEntropyProviderForStudy is

short-circuiting the entropy selection causing the default entropy

provider to be used when a study without Google web experiment ID is

constrained to a limited layer.



This change removes the short-circuiting by checking whether the study must use the limited entropy provider first. The positioning of the logic will override any checks for default and low entropy. OTOH only the check for session entropy can override limit entropy.



Bug: 41491646

entry.title: webauthn: switch EnclaveManager to using callbacks.
entry.content:
Because the EnclaveManager started out life as a TrustedVaultBackend, it

ended up signaling its users via an observer pattern: it would tell them

when it had finished processing requests. But that means that we end up

with one big callback for when all the possible types of requests

finish. We also shoved the StoreKeys signal in there, although that

really is a case where an observer makes sense. Lastly, it made queued

requests difficult to reason about. We still need to make the code

robust to queued requests, but that work is implausible with a single

observer callback.



So this change switches the EnclaveManager to using callbacks for when

operations complete.



Change-Id: I12b0f0137767ea59bd01a807d92db1ec31016ffe

entry.title: Move all entropy selection logic into VariationsLayers.
entry.content:
Currently, the selection of entropy providers for slot randomization

happens in VariationsLayers, but the selection of entropy providers for study randomization happens in ProcessedStudy.



This changes moves the related logic in ProcessedStudy to VariationsLayers. This simplifies usages such as the one in study_filtering.cc, and avoids the need to reference two files when reading code.



This is no change to functionalities.

entry.title: Fix the case of negative-sized scroll_snapport_rect
entry.content:
When the scrollPadding of a scroll container is greater than its size, for

example, if the container has a height of 50px and the scrollPadding is 30px,

the scroll_snapport_rect of this container have a negative height value.

This can lead to unexpected scrolling of the container when scrollIntoView is

called on a child element within the view, ust like the example given in the

bug report.



Therefore, when the size of scroll_snapport_rect is negative, it is necessary

to set it to the minimum non-negative value.

entry.title: [//gpu] Add ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTargetForOverlays()
entry.content:
This function returns GL_TEXTURE_2D for platforms other than Mac and

the platform-specific texture target for Mac. It will be used to convert

clients that have the following pattern:



texture_target = GL_TEXTURE_2D;

texture_target = gpu::GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget();



The existing functions *should be* sufficient for doing this exchange,

but it is challenging to reason in an iron-clad way about correctness

given the different usages and formats involved. It's easiest to

introduce this new variant to make the transitions turnkey, followed by

transitioning these clients along with the others to the final

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget() under a killswitch.



Bug: 41494843

entry.title: view-transition: Ensure resources are cleaned up in all cases.
entry.content:
This change ensures textures generated for a ViewTransition are released

for cases where the transition is aborted before the new Document takes

ownership:



1. If the old Document's renderer crashes after generating the textures

but before the browser is notified that the snapshot operation is

complete. For this, the navigation ID is now created in the browser.



2. If the navigation is cancelled after the browser has been notified

but before the navigation commits. This is done by storing a scoped

object on the NavigationRequest.



3. If the new Document's renderer process terminates before taking

ownership of the resources. This is done by passing a scoped object

managing the resources to the new RWHV after DidCommit. Since the

RWHV lifetime is tied to the renderer process.



Fixed: 40255989

entry.title: [FLEDGE] Provide a way to be more flexible with adComponent returns...
entry.content:
...by optionally dropping some that are not k-anon but still meeting the

bidder's overall requirements.



generateBid() can control this process by setting the desired number of components as targetNumAdComponents in the bid, and denote some as

required via numMandatoryAdComponents.



This is controlled by the same feature flag as multibid (to give our

users less combinations of settings to worry about), but is basically

orthogonal and operates per-bid.

entry.title: Supply the correct paint when drawing Slugs
entry.content:
Previously, the slug was drawn using the SkPaint that was

captured at creation time. That might be incorrect. Image

shaders made from texture-backed images can't be realized

on the renderer process, so the text would just render as

a solid (fallback) color. Now we use the paint created on

the GPU process after PaintFlags serialization.

entry.title: Revert "[HaTS] Run demo survey on dev builds"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b5f5f8a8849dcae599f45d7b25813eeef0033950.



Reason for revert: I think this is the cause of the following failures: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid%3Achrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.ntp.RecentlyClosedBridgeTest%23testOpenRecentlyClosedEntry_Group_FromGroupClosure_WithRestart?q=VHASH%3A22ee31d7397c1286. It's also part of the blamelist for a wider set of failures, though with a less obviously-related symptom.



Original change's description:

> [HaTS] Run demo survey on dev builds

>

> The AndroidHatsRefactor introduce a new flag to govern the new survey behavior. Update the flag in fieldtrial_testing_config so the dev builds can pick it up and run surveys to make sure our code works.

>

> Also extend the metadata from expiring.

>

entry.title: [ios] Avoid LegacyBookmarkModel::root_node() in EG tests
entry.content:
Test-only changes, and in fact without behavioral changes.



This patch is part of a larger series to remove all callers for

LegacyBookmarkModel::root_node(), which doesn't have clear semantics

during the transition phase while feature

`syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is rolling out.



The helper functions modified in this patch can be modified to avoid

using root_node() to iterate all nodes, and instead exercise less

problematic APIs such as GetBookmarksMatchingProperties().

entry.title: [web-tests] Correctly evaluate the `000_run_me_first.https.html` result
entry.content:
`000_run_me_first.https.html` is a fake test run when initializing

`content_shell` to ensure the WebGPU adapter is functioning. After

https://crrev.com/c/5046574 excluded `PASS`ing subtests from the

testharness output, the driver always returned the empty

`000_run_me_first.https.html` text output as the test output [0].

This caused the first test to spuriously pass if that test was a

testharness test, and fail with no output if that test was a reftest.



Update the driver logic to look for an absence of failures instead,

remove expectations no longer needed, and add a TODO to try replacing

`000_run_me_first.https.html` altogether.



[0]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/web_tests/port/driver.py;l=239-240;drc=23e0be190ef9031c0ef5aff22147a51e47c655ca;bpv=0;bpt=0



Bug: 329003665, 1515749, 324436420

Change-Id: I1d2a43e30313645b7610e78db3fed4e8415ffce5
